title: Validity Mirage: Context Compression Failure Modes in LLMs
description: Research on context compression failure modes in large language models. Introduces the validity mirage — where compression preserves surface-level correctness while silently substituting the governing hypothesis — and develops a tropical semiring algebra (max-plus over R ∪ {−∞}) for measuring context health. Validated across five model architectures (Llama 3.1 8B, Mistral 7B v0.3, Gemma 2 9B, Phi-3 Medium 14B, Qwen 2.5 14B) using 11,400+ boundary instances and 4,200+ streaming trials. Tested against 13 real incident graphs (12 NTSB aviation + Knight Capital 2012). Deployed as a production MCP server in Claude Code agentic sessions.
